QRID.question: QRID. Respondent ID (UNIQUE TO EACH RESPONDENT)

QMLangRec.question: QMLangRec. [DO NOT READ] Main language of interview? [INTERVIEWER: THIS QUESTION IS NOT TO BE READ TO RESPONDENT. YOU NEED TO RECORD THE MAIN LANGUAGE SELECTED TO CONDUCT THIS INTERVIEW.]

Q2.question: Q2. How often, if at all, do you follow the news?

Q3rec_2.question: Q3. How have you been getting the news? Newspapers or magazines

Q3rec_3.question: Q3. How have you been getting the news? Radio

Q5.question: Q5. Over the next 12 months, do you expect your economic situation to …?

options.1: Teaching boys to respect all women
options.3: Women are already safe (DO NOT READ)
options.4: Improve law and order/Policing (DO NOT READ)

Q9.question: Q9. How important is it for women to have the same rights as men?

ABORT.question: ABORT. Do you think having an abortion should be …?

Q10.question: Q10. Some feel that we should rely on a democratic form of government to solve our country’s problems. Others feel that we should rely on a leader with a strong hand to solve our country’s problems. Which comes closer to your opinion?

Q12.question: Q12. How much influence should politicians have in religious matters?

Q13.question: Q13. Nowadays, would you say that your health is …?

options.5: Not religious/Do not practice religion/Other/Depends (DO NOT READ)

Q18f.question: Q18. How much do you know about …? f. the Buddhist religion and its practices

Q19a.question: Q19. How important is it for a family to have at least one …? a. son

Q19b.question: Q19. How important is it for a family to have at least one …? b. daughter

QW21b.question: QW21. How important is it to stop women in your community from marrying into another …? b. religion

QM21a.question: QM21. How important is it to stop men in your community from marrying into another …? a. caste

QM21b.question: QM21. How important is it to stop men in your community from marrying into another …? b. religion

Q22a.question: Q22. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for …? a. earning money

Q22b.question: Q22. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for …? b. taking care of children

Q22c.question: Q22. In a family, who should be primarily responsible for …? c. making decisions about expenses

Q23a.question: Q23. Please tell me whether you completely agree, mostly agree, mostly disagree or completely disagree with the following statements. a. A wife must always obey her husband

Q23b.question: Q23. Please tell me whether you completely agree, mostly agree, mostly disagree or completely disagree with the following statements. b. When there are few jobs, men should have more rights to a job than women

Q24.question: Q24. In your opinion, who should have a greater right to parents’ inheritance?

Q26.question: Q26. Which of these three statements comes closest to your opinion?

options.1: Men generally make better political leaders than women [OR]
options.2: Women generally make better political leaders than men [OR]
options.3: In general, women and men make equally good political leaders

QRELSING.question: QRELSING. What is your present religion, if any? Are you Hindu, Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, some other religion or have no religion?

options.96: I do not/my religion does not recognize a caste system (DO NOT READ)
options.97: Not a member of any caste/category/class (DO NOT READ)

QHINDU.question: QHINDU. I would like to ask you about some sects within Hinduism. It is possible that some of these may not be familiar to you. Which, if any, of the sects do you identify with?

QDENOMrec.question: QDENOM. Please tell me which denomination or church, if any, you identify with MOST CLOSELY?

options.6: No denomination or church in particular

QJAIN.question: QJAIN. I would like to ask you about some schools of thought or traditions within Jainism. It is possible that some of these may not be familiar to you. Which, if any, of the schools of thought or traditions do you identify with?

options.3: Some other school of thought or tradition [SPECIFY QJAINb]  [OR]
options.4: No school of thought or tradition in particular

Q3132rec.question: Q3132rec. [IF CHRISTIAN: Aside from weddings and funerals,] how often do you [go to the temple/attend the mosque for namaz/go to the gurudwara/attend religious services]?

Q33a.question: Q33. Have you ever prayed, meditated or performed a ritual at a ...? a. Hindu temple

Q33b.question: Q33. Have you ever prayed, meditated or performed a ritual at a ...? b. Mosque

Q34a.question: Q34. How often do you ..., if at all? a. meditate

Q34b.question: Q34. How often do you ..., if at all? b. practice yoga

Q35.question: Q35. How important is religion in your life?

Q36a.question: Q36. Have you ever …? a. made a pilgrimage

Q36b.question: Q36. Have you ever …? b. participated in or witnessed animal sacrifices for religious purposes

Q36c.question: Q36. Have you ever …? c. received purification by taking a dip in a holy body of water, like the Ganges River

Q37b.question: Q37. Do you …? b. give money to any other charitable causes

Q37e.question: Q37. Do you …? e. sing devotionally

Q37f.question: Q37. Do you …? f. dance devotionally

Q37h.question: Q37. Do you …? h. have holy basil at home

Q37i.question: Q37. Do you …? i. fix important dates, such as for a wedding, based on auspicious times or dates

options.3: My family follows one, but I do not (DO NOT READ)

Q39b.question: Q39. How often do you watch …, if at all? b. Other serials

options.1: My religion is the one true religion

options.1: Childhood religion same as current religion

options.2: There is only one God with many manifestations [OR]

Q44rec_7.question: Q44. Do you believe in God? [If yes] Do you feel closest to any God? If so, which one? Yes, Saraswati

Q44rec_13.question: Q44. Do you believe in God? [If yes] Do you feel closest to any God? If so, which one? Yes, Murugan

Q44rec_14.question: Q44. Do you believe in God? [If yes] Do you feel closest to any God? If so, which one? Yes, the Sun

Q44rec_15.question: Q44. Do you believe in God? [If yes] Do you feel closest to any God? If so, which one? Yes, Jesus

Q44rec_16.question: Q44. Do you believe in God? [If yes] Do you feel closest to any God? If so, which one? Yes, another God

Q47b.question: Q47. Do you ever ask God for … for you or your family? b. prosperity

Q47c.question: Q47. Do you ever ask God for … for you or your family? c. forgiveness

options.2: Is not the word of God

options.1: There is only ONE true way to interpret the teachings of my religion [OR]
options.2: There is MORE than one true way to interpret the teachings of my religion

Q53b.question: Q53. Do you perform puja …? b. at temple

Q55b.question: Q55b. Do you abstain from eating root vegetables, such as garlic and onion?

Q55c.question: Q55c. Do you abstain from eating meat on certain days?

Q55d.question: Q55d. Do you abstain from eating certain meats?

Q56a.question: Q56. Would you ever eat food …? a. in a restaurant that serves both vegetarian and non-vegetarian food

Q56d.question: Q56. Would you ever eat food …? d. at a function hosted by people whose religion has different rules about food than yours

Q58xb.question: Q58x. In a family, who should have the primary responsibility ...? b. for a parent’s [IF CHRISTIAN OR MUSLIM INSERT “burial rituals”; ELSE INSERT “last rites”]

options.3: Neither benefits nor harms (DO NOT READ)

options.1: Support Muslims going to their own religious court
options.2: Oppose Muslims going to their own religious court

options.3: Neither good nor bad (DO NOT READ)

Q69a.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? a. To be able to speak Hindi

Q69b.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? b. To be a Hindu

Q69c.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? c. To respect the army

Q69d.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? d. To stand for the national anthem

Q69e.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? e. To respect elders

Q69f.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? f. To respect all religions

Q69g.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? g. To know the history of India’s freedom struggle

Q69h.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? h. To respect the country’s institutions and laws

Q69i.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? i. To support India’s cricket team

Q69j.question: Q69. Some people say that the following things are important to be truly Indian. Others say that they are not important. How important do you think it is ... to be truly Indian? j. To have Indian ancestry

Q70.question: Q70. Please tell me if you completely agree, mostly agree, mostly disagree or completely disagree with the following statement: Indian people are not perfect, but Indian culture is superior to others.

Q72a.question: Q72. Do you generally …? a. wear a religious pendant, such as an amulet, cross, image or symbol of God

Q72b.question: Q72. Do you generally …? b. wear a bindi

Q72c.question: Q72. Do you generally …? c. wear a skullcap

Q72d.question: Q72. Do you generally …? d. wear a turban

Q72e.question: Q72. Do you generally …? e. wear a janeu

Q72f.question: Q72. Do you generally …? f. wear a tilak

Q72g.question: Q72. Do you generally …? g. wear a kara

Q72h.question: Q72. Do you generally …? h. carry a kirpan

Q72i.question: Q72. Do you generally …? i. keep your hair long

Q73a.question: Q73a. Outside your home, do you keep the practice of covering your head?

q73abrec.question: Q73abrec. Outside your home, do you keep the practice of covering your head? [If yes] Do you wear a …?

options.4: Yes cover head, something else (DO NOT READ)

QFERTrec.question: QFERTrec. How many children have you had? Please count all children born at any time in your life.

options.96: Do not know number of daughters
options.98: Do not know number of children

QHH1.question: QHH1. How many people, including yourself, live in your household?

QHH2.question: QHH2. How many, including yourself, are adults, age 18 and older?

options.1: Married or living with a partner
options.2: Divorced, separated, partner is no longer alive

QSPRELrec.question: QSPRELrec. What is your [spouse/partner]’s religion, if any? Are they Hindu, Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, some other religion or no religion?

options.999: Don’t know/Refused for own religion and/or spouse’s religion

QCHSPRELrec.question: QCHSPRELrec.Was your spouse/partner raised [QSPREL]? [If no] What religion was your spouse/partner raised as, if any? Were they Hindu, Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, some other religion or no religion?

options.1: Yes, spouse’s childhood religion same as their current religion
options.2: No, spouse raised in a different religion than their current religion
options.999: DK/ Ref spouse current religion and/or spouse’s childhood religion

QHHCH.question: QHHCH. Are you the parent or legal guardian of any children under the age of 18 who currently live in your household?

QCHILDrec.question: QCHILDrec. In what religion, if any, are you raising your child/children? Are they being raised Hindu, Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, some other religion or no religion?

options.1: Raising child/children in same religion as respondent
options.2: Raising child/children in different religion than respondent
options.999: Do not know/ Refused own current religion or in which religion raising child

Q74a.question: Q74. Does your child/do your children ever …? a. [go to the temple/go to the mosque/go to the gurudwara/attend religious services]

options.3: Not applicable/Children too young (DO NOT READ)

Q74b.question: Q74. Does your child/do your children ever …? b. Pray

options.3: Not applicable/Children too young (DO NOT READ)

Q74c.question: Q74. Does your child/do your children ever …? c. Read scripture

options.3: Not applicable/Children too young (DO NOT READ)

Q74d.question: Q74. Does your child/do your children ever …? d. Receive religious instruction outside the home

options.3: Not applicable/Children too young (DO NOT READ)

Q75.question: Q75. How important is it for you that children in your family keep their hair long?

Q76.question: Q76. Do you currently live in a joint family?

options.2: Voted, Congress Party / Indian National Congress (INC)
options.997: Was not eligible to vote in last national election (DO NOT READ)

QEDU.question: QEDU. What is the highest level of school you have completed or the highest degree received?

options.5: High school; Industrial training institute (matriculation certificate or ITI certificate)
options.6: Senior secondary / Intermediate (senior secondary school leaving certificate)
options.8: Nursing, general nursing and midwifery (GNM); Junior teachers training (diploma)
